verses.text: 亞達薛西王二十年尼散月，王面前擺上了酒席，我拿酒來奉給王。我在他面前素來沒有露出愁容。

words.note: Directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker.

verses.text: 王卻問我：「你既然沒有病，為甚麼面帶愁容呢？這沒有別的可能，必是心中愁煩。」我就非常懼怕，
對王說：「願王萬歲，我列祖墳墓所在的城成了荒蕪之地，城門被火焚毀，我怎能不面帶愁容呢？」

words.note: An ancient salutation to an emperor or king.
Classical Chinese possessive or attributive particle.

verses.text: 王問我：「你想要甚麼呢？」我就向天上的 神禱告，

words.note: A blank space used for reverence before names of deities or royalty.

verses.text: 然後對王說：「如果王認為好，僕人能在你面前蒙恩寵，就請你差派我往猶大，到我列祖墳墓所在的城去，讓我重建那城。」

words.note: A fixed verbal phrase meaning 'to be shown favor or grace'.
Directional complement indicating movement away or purpose.

verses.text: 那時，王后坐在王的旁邊。王問我：「你的行程需時多久？你甚麼時候回來？」王既然認為好，就差派我去，我也定了一個歸期。

words.note: Primarily used in formal or historical contexts.

verses.text: 我又問王：「王若是認為好，請賜給我詔書，通知河西那邊的省長准我經過，直至我到達猶大；

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts.
Refers to official royal commands in ancient times.
More formal than '直到'.

verses.text: 又賜詔書，給看守王的園林的亞薩，吩咐他給我木材，建造聖殿的營樓大門的橫梁，以及建造城牆和我要入住的房屋。」因為我的 神施恩的手幫助我，王就賜給我這一切。

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts.
Refers to official royal commands in ancient times.
More formal than '叫'.
Refers specifically to a holy temple, often for worship.
Specific to military or defensive structures, common in historical texts.
Technical term in construction.
Refers to the singular, capitalized God in a religious context.
Commonly used in religious contexts regarding divine favor.
Often used in formal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 於是我到了河西那邊的省長那裡去，把王的詔書交給他們；王又派了軍長和馬兵護送我。

words.note: Indicates that the following noun is the object being acted upon.
Refers to official royal commands in ancient times.
More common in historical or military contexts.
Refers to soldiers on horseback, common in historical texts.

verses.text: 和倫人參巴拉和作臣僕的亞捫人多比雅聽見有人來到，要為以色列求利益，他們就非常惱怒。

words.note: A transliterated name with the suffix for 'people'.
Refers to a royal subject or servant, common in historical/religious texts.
A transliterated name with the suffix for 'people'.
Lit. 'not common', hence 'extraordinary, extremely'.
Stronger than '生氣' (angry).

verses.text: 我到了耶路撒冷，在那裡停留了三天。
verses.heading: Nehemiah Arrives in Jerusalem

verses.text: 我在夜間起來，和幾個人一起出去，我沒有告訴任何人我的 神使我定意要為耶路撒冷作的事，除了我所騎的一頭牲口以外，沒有帶著別的牲口。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with following verb

verses.text: 我夜間出了谷門，向著龍泉走去，到了糞門，視察耶路撒冷破壞了的城牆和被火焚毀的城門。
我又往前走，到了泉門和王池，因為地方不夠讓我騎著牲口過去，
我只得在夜間沿溪而上，視察城牆，然後轉回，經過谷門，回到城裡。

words.note: Connects clauses, often sequential or indicating consequence

verses.text: 沒有一個官長知道我去過甚麼地方，作了甚麼事。我也一直沒有告訴猶大人、或祭司、或貴胄、或官長，或其餘作工的人。

words.note: Refers to government or religious leaders.
Refers to people of noble birth.
Refers to government or religious leaders.

verses.text: 後來我對他們說：「你們都看見我們遭遇的患難：耶路撒冷成了荒蕪之地，城門被火焚毀，你們都來吧！讓我們重建耶路撒冷的城牆，免得我們再受凌辱。」

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的'.
A strong term for being shamed or disgraced.

verses.text: 我告訴他們，我的 神施恩的手怎樣幫助我，以及王對我所說的話；他們就說：「我們要起來建造！」於是他們奮勇著手作這善工。

words.note: Capitalized '神' refers to the one God.
Formal conjunction.
Used to form nominal phrases from verbs.
Formal conjunction, often used in narrative.
Refers to work that is righteous or beneficial.

verses.text: 但和倫人參巴拉和作臣僕的亞捫人多比雅，以及阿拉伯人基善聽見了，就譏笑我們，藐視我們，說：「你們在幹甚麼？你們要背叛王嗎？」

words.note: Refers to the ethnicity/origin of Sanballat.
Often used in biblical texts for servants of rulers or God.
Formal conjunction.
Refers to the ancient Arab people in this context.
Strong term for looking down on someone.

verses.text: 我回答他們說：「天上的 神必使我們成功；我們是他的僕人，我們要起來建造，但你們在耶路撒冷無分、無權，無人記念。」

words.note: Refers to the realm of God.
Capitalized '神' refers to the one God.
Indicates strong conviction or necessity.
Refers to God in this context.
Often used in religious contexts for 'servant of God'.
Implies no rightful claim or portion.
Implies no authority or legal claim.
Here implies no one will honor or recognize them.
